quote: Well Bones, do the new medical facilities meet with your approval?
They do not. It's like working in a damn computer center.
Spock, will you please sit down!
Just a moment, Captain, sir. I'll explain what happened. Your revered Admiral Nogura invoked a little known, seldom used, reserve activation clause. In simpler language, Captain, they drafted me!
Spock. This child is about to wipe out every living thing on Earth. Now, what do you suggest we do....spank it?
Your child is having a tantrum, Mr. Spock.

(McCoy) Spock, you haven't changed a bit. You're just as warm and friendly as ever.

Nor have you, Doctor, as your continued predilection for irrelevancy demonstrates.

(Kirk) It was the best of times, it was the worst of times...Message, Spock?

None that I am concious of... except, of course, Happy Birthday. Surely the best of times.
Humour. It is a difficult concept.
Who's been holding up the damn elevator?

(Spock) It has always been easier to destroy that to create.

Not anymore! Now we can do both at the same time. According to myth, the Earth was created in six days. Now watch out! Here comes Genesis, we'll do it for ya in six minutes.

(McCoy) Where are we going?

(Kirk) Where they went.

(McCoy) What if they went nowhere?

Then this will be your big chance to get away from it all.
(Sulu) I’ m delighted. Any chance to go aboard the Enterprise. /nWell, I for one am glad to have you at the helm for three weeks.I don 't think these kids can steer.

(Spock) In any case, were I to invoke logic, logic clearly dictates that the needs of the many outweigh the needs of the few.

Or the one.
I have been, and ever shall be, your friend. Live long, and prosper.
How many fingers am I holding up?
That's not very damn funny.
Don’t call me Tiny.

(Kirk) You’re suffering from a Vulcan Mind Meld, Doctor.

That green - blooded Son of a Bitch. It's his revenge for all those arguments he lost to me.

(Kirk) My God, what have I done?

What you always do. Turn death into a fighting chance to live.

(Kirk) You’re not exactly catching us at our best.

That much is certain.
No, I'm from Iowa. I only work in outer space.
Avoid the planet Earth at all costs. Farewell.

(Kirk) Spock, where the hell's the power you promised?

One damn minute, admiral.

(Kirk) Him? He's harmless. Back in the 60's he was part of the peace movement at Berkeley. I think he did a little too much LDS.

(Dr.Taylor) LDS?

Umm-huh.
Damn medievalism!

(Kirk) Nobody understands you in this century unless you swear every other word. You'll find it in all the literature of the era: Jackelyn Susann, the novels of Harrold Robbins.

Ah, the giants.
Sounds more like the goddam Spanish Inquisition.

(Naval Commander) Don’t mess around with me or you're through!

Really? Can I go now?

(Spock) Captain, I do not believe you realize the gravity of your situation.

On the contrary, gravity is the foremost thing on my mind.
Jim, you don't go around asking the Almighty for his I.D.!
Captain, life is not a dream.

(Spock) I was attempting to ascertain the meaning of the lyrics.

(McCoy) It's a song, you green-blooded...Vulcan. You don't analyse it. The point is you have a good time singing it.

Oh, I am sorry, Doctor. Were we having a good time?

(McCoy) Beans. My great grand daddy's recipe. With a secret ingredient.

Beans and bourbon. An explosive combination.
I need a shower.
Please Captain, not in front of the Klingons.
To be... or not to be... that is the question which troubles my people.
Guess who's coming to dinner?
Where's that damn torpedo?

(Kirk) Uhura, signal our surrender.

(Uhura) Captain?!

We surrender!

(Spock) Ahh, Mr.Scott, I understand you're having difficulty with the warp drive. How much time do you require for repair?

(Scotty) There’ s nothing wrong with the bloody thing!

(Spock) Mr.Scott, if we return to Spacedock, the assassins will surely find a way to dispose of their incriminating footwear, and we will never see the captain, or Dr.McCoy, alive again.

(Scotty) Could take weeks, sir.

Thank you, Mr.Scott.
If I were human, I believe the correct response would be 'Go to Hell.'

(Chang) I am constant as the Northern Star.

I'd give real money if he'd shut up.
You can't appreciate Shakespeare until you've read him in the original Klingon.
Logic is the beginning of wisdom; not the end.
Oh, shit!!!
I was out saving the galaxy when your grandfather was in diapers.
You will excuse me now, Captain. I have an appointment with eternity and I don't want to be late.
Life forms.... You tiny little life forms..... You precious little life forms.... Where are you?
Time is the fire in which we burn...
Normal is what everyone else is and you are not.
Seize the time, Meribor. Live now; make now always the most precious time. Now will never come again.
Shields up! Rrrrred alert!
episode: The Best of Both Worlds, Part I (TNG)

quote: Eaten any good books lately?
You're so stolid. You weren't like that before the beard.
‘With the first link, the chain is forged. The first speech censored, the first thought forbidden, the first freedom denied, chains us all irrevocably.’
Fate protects fools, little children and ships named Enterprise.
Let's make sure that history never forgets the name... Enterprise.
If you prick me, do I not... leak?
If there's nothing wrong with me... maybe there's something wrong with the universe!
The universe is a spheroid region, 705 metres in diameter.
Nice Legs... for a human.
Jean-Luc! It's so good to see you again. How about a big hug?
I am not a merry man!

If you can't take a little bloody nose, maybe you oughtta go back home and crawl under your bed. It's not safe out here. It's wondrous, with treasures to satiate desires both subtle and gross; but it's not for the timid.
Spot. This is down. Down is good.
Please Mrs. Troi! ... and it's Worf, not Woof.
All good things must come to an end...
Besides, you look good in a dress.
Sometimes a cigar is just a cigar!

(Data)You must talk to him; tell him that he is a good cat, and a pretty cat, and…

I will feed him.
Some of the colonists objected to having an anatomically correct android running around without any clothes on.
Captain, we're receiving two hundred and eighty-five thousand hails.
Synthetic Scotch, synthetic Commanders...
… and get that fish out of my ready room.
Policemen, I'd recognize them in any century.
You're dead, this is the afterlife, and I'm God.
Yes, absolutely, I do indeed concur, wholeheartedly!
Well, he did make a pass at me... and it was a good one!
The Federation's gone; the Borg is everywhere!
Captain's Personal Log, supplemental. I have just witnessed the total destruction of the U.S.S. Enterprise with the loss of all hands. Save one. Me.
(Locutus) I will continue, aboard this ship, to speak for the Borg. While they continue, without further diversion, to Sector 001, where they will force your unconditional surrender.
episode: The Best of Both Worlds II (TNG)

quote: I’m not suppsed to be here, sir. I'm.....supposed to be dead!
Starfleet reports it has engaged the Borg at Wolf 359, sir.
episode: The Best of Both Worlds II (TNG)

quote: Mr. Crusher, ready a collision course with the Borg ship.
episode: The Best of Both Worlds II (TNG)

quote: And how do I know that someone I might save down there might not be the next Adolf Hitler? Or Khan Singh? I'm willing to take that chance.
Who knows if we're even dead or alive?
We have engaged...the Borg.
episode: The Best of Both Worlds I (TNG)

quote: Legends...are the spice of the universe, Mr. Data, because they have a way of sometimes coming true.
Baby needs a new pair of shoes.
One thing is clear - you'll never look at your hairline again in the same way.
It's time to put an end to your trek through the stars.
Five card stud, nothing wild. And the sky's the limit.
We will add your biological and technological distinctiveness to our own. Your culture will adapt to service us. Resistance is futile. We are the Borg.
episode: The Best of Both Worlds, Part I (TNG)

quote: Good tea. Nice house.
We do exactly what we would do if this Q never existed. If we're going to be damned, let's be damned for who we really are.
Q might have done the right thing for the wrong reason, perhaps we need a good kick in our complacency to get us ready for what's ahead.
Did the table do something wrong?
Sir, you have no sense of fair play?
Your head is not an artifact!
Ah. I understand the source of your misperception, but this is not sleepwear, and I do not have a 'missus.'
Thank you for the advice, but I am trying to find two individuals with a snake.
There are four lights!
... a dream that became a reality and spread throughout the stars.
Just before they went into warp, I beamed the whole kit and kaboodle into their engine room, where they'll be no tribble at all.
Right out of hell, I saw it!
You will die of suffocation, in the icy cold of space.
The mid-1990s was the era of your so-called Third World War.
We simply must accept the fact that Captain Kirk is no longer alive.
They seemed to have been spared the agony of your first three World Wars, doctor.
You are authorized to use all measures available to destroy the Enterpise.
I didn't mean to say that the Enterprise should be hauling garbage. I meant to say that it should be hauled away AS garbage.
You look quite well for a man that's been 'utterly destroyed', Mr. Spock.
In four hours the ship blows up.
Computer, compute to the last digit the value of pi.
Mr. Spock, the women on your planet are logical. That's the only planet in the galaxy that can make that claim.
Ston, she is yours. You may find that having is not so pleasing a thing as wanting. This is not logical, but it is often true.
The best diplomat that I know is a fully-loaded phaser bank.
I signed aboard this ship to practice medicine, not to have my atoms scattered back and forth across space by this gadget.
By golly, Jim... I'm beginning to think I can cure a rainy day!
I find myself growing fatigued, Doctor. May we continue this questioning at some other time?
(Locutus) Resistance is futile. You will disarm your weapons, and escort us to Sector 001. If you attempt to intervene, we will destroy you.
Picard would never have hit me...
Die with honour.
I'm a doctor, not a botanist.
In my expert medical opinion, I'd say... it's sick.

(Kira) If your lies are going to be this transparent, this is going to be a very short interrogation.

Then I'll try to make my lies more opaque...
I'm sorry, Commander, but I've learned we can't afford to die here, not even once.
Do I annoy you ?
He's still dead, if that's what you mean.
Whoah! What's that? Is that a spider or a dog?
The Provisional Government is going to fall, and when governments fall people like me are the first ones shot.
Cardassian rule may have been oppressive, but at least it was simple.
Laws change depending on who's making them, but justice is justice.
Rom's an idiot. He couldn't fix a straw if it was bent.
I am sorry I have no vices for you to exploit.
I don't get out often.
Nothing makes them happy! They are dedicated to being unhappy, and to spreading that unhappiness to others! They are the Ambassadors of Unhappy!

(Bashir) A bite on the hand is certainly worth saving a boy's life, wouldn't you say?

I suppose it depends on whose hand.... just joking, Doctor.
We can't have these Bajorans going around killing each other.
The truth is usually just an excuse for a lack of imagination.
This is not a synthale kind of night.
Captain, are you aware there's a Klingon on your bridge?
All I ask is a tall ship, and a load of contraband to fill her with...
I'm a much more complicated man than you give me credit for, Major.
I'm sorry if I made you feel... unwelcome. It's just my way.
You've got a good start on a novel here, Jake. The dialog is sharp, the story is interesting, the characters are real... the spelling is terrible.
I hate prototypes.

(Odo) I see I'm going to have to add the word pickpocket to your resume.

It's only a hobby.
Constable, why are you talking to your beverage?
There's an old saying, Fortune favors the bold. Well, I guess we're about to find out.
Why pretend we're going home at all when all we're really going to do is investigate every cubic millimter of this quadrant, aren't we?
I don't like threats, I don't like bullies, and I don't like you!
Get the cheese to sickbay!
It appears we have lost our sex appeal, Captain.
Now's as good a time as any to tell you. Your ceiling is hideous.

The procedure is quite simple. I'll drill an opening into your skull percisely two milimeters in diameter and then use a neuralyte probe to extract a sample of your parietal lobe weighing approximately one gram.

(Q) Trouble sleeping, Captain?

...Get out.
Your voice says to go away, but your heart wants me to make you smile!
You're on your way to being normal, although I 'm not sure how normal applies to a species who suppress all their emotions.

(Janeway) Doctor, I forgot all about you!

How flattering.
Well, isn't this just fine! Humans aren't supposed to be in this quadrant for 100 years!
Facial art... ooh, how... wilderness of you!
This ship will not survive the formation of the cosmos!

(Janeway) Where are we now?

We seem to be tethered to some sort of... plant.
Can't you see, Captain? For us, the disease is immortality.
Fear exists for one purpose: to be conquered.
Oh, I see! This is one of those silly human rituals. You're playing hard to get!
Captain ... I believe I speak for everyone here, sir, when I say, 'To Hell with our orders.'
Believing oneself to be perfect is often the sign of a delusional mind.

They invade our space, and we fall back. They assimilate countless worlds, and we fall back. Not again. Not this time. The line must be drawn here! This far, no farther! And I will make them pay for what they have done!
Smooth as an android's bottom, eh, Data?
We're through running from these bastards.
Definitely feeling agressive tendencies, sir.
Does anyone remember when we were explorers?
In the event of a water landing, I have been designed to act as a floatation device.
The Son'a wish to negotiate a cease-fire. It may have something to do with the fact that we only have three minutes of air left.
